cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 88 (Tuesday, May 21, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YAKYM:H.R. 8468.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:This legislation would prohibit students and faculty fromreceiving federal student loan forgiveness if they areexpelled or terminated for a hate crime, disorderly conduct,trespassing, creating a public disturbance, or violatingtitles IV or VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.[Page H3398]

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
